nodes.bodyText:
Please remove final in your changes. That just adds clutter to the code and doesn't really do anything

I have to disagree with following reasons:

it should help to distinguish which variables are variable and
final variables does the code flow pretty staight forward. I mean if variable is final, there are no side effects and I can concentrate to pitfals of reused variables (wich may be really nasty). For example trying to find where regis variable comes consumes a lot of brain power (which have to be gathered from chocolate or coffe): 
  
    
      Payara/appserver/web/web-core/src/main/java/org/apache/catalina/core/StandardContext.java
    
    
         Line 3624
      in
      75cc478
    
    
    
    

        
          
           return regis; 
        
    
  


final variables reduces scope where variable might be set and improves learning curve of code for contributors (by reducing possibilities where variable can be changed)
non final variables are like exclamation mark and acts like point of interest in case of hunting bugs
in old codebase final reveals scoping problems (

before (C89 declaration style):
String x = null;
while (...) {
  x = "some String";
  ...
}

after (Java style):
while (...) {
  final String x = "some String";
  ...
}

I know some time ago there was a discussion, but I do not know the final decision.
For reference there is PR in commons-lang3 with the similar idiom. apache/commons-lang@37c2231
Another insteresting references

https://softwareengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/98691/excessive-use-final-keyword-in-java
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/137868/using-the-final-modifier-whenever-applicable-in-java

So if there is consensus on that the final is just garbage, I can discard the last commit.
Personally I would preffer to use final at least in methods that are longer than usual and contains if constructs. In case final keyword is not wanted in all possible places.

This reminds me of putting const everywhere you can in C++.
Everything is good in moderation, this is way beyond the scope of this PR
and doesn't go with the rest of the code.
Please remove finals.
thank you
But you are right in code review, it should be in different PR.
